explains: adj. 艳丽的；火焰似的；炫耀的

sentences.en: Critics attack his lavish spending and flamboyant style.
sentences.cn: 批评家们抨击他的挥霍无度和过分夸张的作风。

sentences.en: Freddie Mercury was a flamboyant star of the hard rock scene.
sentences.cn: 弗雷迪·默丘里曾是硬摇滚乐舞台上一颗耀眼的明星。

sentences.en: Unlike the general run of peasantry they had a taste for flamboyant dress and gesture; but they usually shared the peasants' religious beliefs and superstitions.
sentences.cn: 和一般的农民不同，他们喜欢华丽的服饰和姿态；但他们通常与农民有着相同的宗教信仰和迷信。
